final_answer:
The humor in this image arises from the incongruity and absurdity illustrated in the two panels. 

On the left, there is an empty fridge door compartment, logically designed to hold eggs. However, the right panel humorously contrasts this by showing a full egg carton awkwardly placed in another compartment instead of utilizing the intended one. This scenario exaggerates improper storage, highlighting the absurdity of trying to fit something in an unsuitable space while the appropriate spot remains unused.

The "Yes, But" structure satirically emphasizes the disconnect between having the right solution and choosing a less practical option, creating the comedic effect.
